description.full:

Custom transitions can be added via $.ui.availableTransitions

description.full:
This is a boolean that when set to true will add "&cache=rand" to any ajax loaded link
The default is false

           $.ui.useAjaxCacheBuster=true;
description.summary:
This is a boolean that when set to true will add "&cache=rand" to any ajax loaded link
The default is false

description.full:
This is a shorthand call to the $.actionsheet plugin. We wire it to the afui div automatically

           $.ui.actionsheet("Settings Logout")
           $.ui.actionsheet("[{
                        text: 'back',
                        cssClasses: 'red',
                        handler: function () { $.ui.goBack(); ; }
                    }, {
                        text: 'show alert 5',
                        cssClasses: 'blue',
                        handler: function () { alert("hi"); }
                    }, {
                        text: 'show alert 6',
                        cssClasses: '',
                        handler: function () { alert("goodbye"); }
                    }]");
description.summary:
This is a shorthand call to the $.actionsheet plugin. We wire it to the afui div automatically

           $.ui.actionsheet("Settings Logout")
           $.ui.actionsheet("[{
                        text: 'back',
                        cssClasses: 'red',
                        handler: function () { $.ui.goBack(); ; }
                    }, {
                        text: 'show alert 5',
                        cssClasses: 'blue',
                        handler: function () { alert("hi"); }
                    }, {
                        text: 'show alert 6',
                        cssClasses: '',
                        handler: function () { alert("goodbye"); }
                    }]");

description.full:
This is a wrapper to $.popup.js plugin. If you pass in a text string, it acts like an alert box and just gives a message

           $.ui.popup(opts);
           $.ui.popup( {
                        title:"Alert! Alert!",
                        message:"This is a test of the emergency alert system!! Don't PANIC!",
                        cancelText:"Cancel me",
                        cancelCallback: function(){console.log("cancelled");},
                        doneText:"I'm done!",
                        doneCallback: function(){console.log("Done for!");},
                        cancelOnly:false
                      });
           $.ui.popup('Hi there');
description.summary:
This is a wrapper to $.popup.js plugin. If you pass in a text string, it acts like an alert box and just gives a message

           $.ui.popup(opts);
           $.ui.popup( {
                        title:"Alert! Alert!",
                        message:"This is a test of the emergency alert system!! Don't PANIC!",
                        cancelText:"Cancel me",
                        cancelCallback: function(){console.log("cancelled");},
                        doneText:"I'm done!",
                        doneCallback: function(){console.log("Done for!");},
                        cancelOnly:false
                      });
           $.ui.popup('Hi there');

description.full:
Update a badge on the selected target. Position can be
bl = bottom left
tl = top left
br = bottom right
tr = top right (default)

           $.ui.updateBadge("#mydiv","3","bl","green");
description.summary:
Update a badge on the selected target. Position can be
bl = bottom left
tl = top left
br = bottom right
tr = top right (default)

description.full:
Load a content panel in a modal window. 

           $.ui.showModal("#myDiv","fade");
description.summary:
Load a content panel in a modal window. 

           $.ui.showModal("#myDiv","fade");

description.full:
Hide the modal window and remove the content. We remove any event listeners on the contents.

           $.ui.hideModal("");
description.summary:
Hide the modal window and remove the content. We remove any event listeners on the contents.

           $.ui.hideModal("");

description.full:
Update the HTML in a content panel

           $.ui.updatePanel("#myDiv","This is the new content");
description.summary:
Update the HTML in a content panel

           $.ui.updatePanel("#myDiv","This is the new content");

description.full:
Same as $.ui.updatePanel. kept for backwards compatibility

           $.ui.updateContentDiv("#myDiv","This is the new content");
description.summary:
Same as $.ui.updatePanel. kept for backwards compatibility

           $.ui.updateContentDiv("#myDiv","This is the new content");

description.full:
Dynamically creates a new panel. It wires events, creates the scroller, applies Android fixes, etc.

           $.ui.addContentDiv("myDiv","This is the new content","Title");
description.summary:
Dynamically creates a new panel. It wires events, creates the scroller, applies Android fixes, etc.

           $.ui.addContentDiv("myDiv","This is the new content","Title");

description.full:
Takes a div and sets up scrolling for it..

           $.ui.addDivAndScroll(object);
description.summary:
Takes a div and sets up scrolling for it..

           $.ui.addDivAndScroll(object);

description.full:
crollEl = tmp.cloneNode(false);

            tmp.title = null;
            tmp.id = null;
            var $tmp = $(tmp);
            $tmp.removeAttr("data-footer data-aside data-nav data-header selected data-load data-unload data-tab data-crc title data-title");

            $tmp.replaceClass("panel", "afScrollPanel");

            scrollEl.appendChild(tmp);

            container.appendChild(scrollEl);
description.summary: crollEl = tmp.cloneNode(false);
description.body:
tmp.title = null;
            tmp.id = null;
            var $tmp = $(tmp);
            $tmp.removeAttr("data-footer data-aside data-nav data-header selected data-load data-unload data-tab data-crc title data-title");

            $tmp.replaceClass("panel", "afScrollPanel");

            scrollEl.appendChild(tmp);

            container.appendChild(scrollEl);

description.full:
Scrolls a panel to the top

           $.ui.scrollToTop(id);
description.summary:
Scrolls a panel to the top

           $.ui.scrollToTop(id);

description.full:
Scrolls a panel to the bottom

           $.ui.scrollToBottom(id,time);
description.summary:
Scrolls a panel to the bottom

           $.ui.scrollToBottom(id,time);

description.full:
This is used when a transition fires to do helper events. We check to see if we need to change the nav menus, footer, and fire
the load/onload functions for panels

           $.ui.parsePanelFunctions(currentDiv,oldDiv);
description.summary:
This is used when a transition fires to do helper events. We check to see if we need to change the nav menus, footer, and fire
the load/onload functions for panels

           $.ui.parsePanelFunctions(currentDiv,oldDiv);

description.full: Helper function that parses a contents html for any script tags and either adds them or executes the code
description.summary: Helper function that parses a contents html for any script tags and either adds them or executes the code

description.full:
This is called to initiate a transition or load content via ajax.
We can pass in a hash+id or URL and then we parse the panel for additional functions

           $.ui.loadContent("#main",false,false,"up");
description.summary:
This is called to initiate a transition or load content via ajax.
We can pass in a hash+id or URL and then we parse the panel for additional functions

           $.ui.loadContent("#main",false,false,"up");

description.full:
This is called internally by loadContent. Here we are loading a div instead of an Ajax link

           $.ui.loadDiv("#main",false,false,"up");
description.summary:
This is called internally by loadContent. Here we are loading a div instead of an Ajax link

           $.ui.loadDiv("#main",false,false,"up");

description.full:
ar fnc = what.getAttribute("data-load");
if (typeof fnc == "string" && window[fnc]) {
windowfnc;
}
$(what).trigger("loadpanel");
description.summary:
ar fnc = what.getAttribute("data-load");
if (typeof fnc == "string" && window[fnc]) {
windowfnc;
}
$(what).trigger("loadpanel");

description.full:
This is called internally by loadDiv. This sets up the back button in the header and scroller for the panel

           $.ui.loadContentData("#main",false,false,"up");
description.summary:
This is called internally by loadDiv. This sets up the back button in the header and scroller for the panel

           $.ui.loadContentData("#main",false,false,"up");

description.full:
This is called internally by loadContent. Here we are using Ajax to fetch the data

           $.ui.loadDiv("page.html",false,false,"up");
description.summary:
This is called internally by loadContent. Here we are using Ajax to fetch the data

           $.ui.loadDiv("page.html",false,false,"up");

description.full:
This executes the transition for the panel

            $.ui.runTransition(transition,oldDiv,currDiv,back)
description.summary:
This executes the transition for the panel

            $.ui.runTransition(transition,oldDiv,currDiv,back)

description.full:
This is callled when you want to launch afui. If autoLaunch is set to true, it gets called on DOMContentLoaded.
If autoLaunch is set to false, you can manually invoke it.

           $.ui.autoLaunch=false;
           $.ui.launch();
description.summary:
This is callled when you want to launch afui. If autoLaunch is set to true, it gets called on DOMContentLoaded.
If autoLaunch is set to false, you can manually invoke it.

           $.ui.autoLaunch=false;
           $.ui.launch();

description.full:
his.asideMenu = $.create("div", {
id: "aside_menu",
html: '

'
}).get(0);
this.viewportContainer.append(this.asideMenu);
this.asideMenu.style.overflow = "hidden";
this.scrollingDivs.menu_scroller = $.query("#aside_menu_scroller").scroller({
scrollBars: true,
verticalScroll: true,
vScrollCSS: "afScrollbar",
useJsScroll: !$.feat.nativeTouchScroll,
noParent: $.feat.nativeTouchScroll,
autoEnable: true,
lockBounce: this.lockPageBounce
});

            if ($.feat.nativeTouchScroll) $.query("#aside_menu_scroller").css("height", "100%");
description.summary:
his.asideMenu = $.create("div", {
id: "aside_menu",
html: '

'
}).get(0);
this.viewportContainer.append(this.asideMenu);
this.asideMenu.style.overflow = "hidden";
this.scrollingDivs.menu_scroller = $.query("#aside_menu_scroller").scroller({
scrollBars: true,
verticalScroll: true,
vScrollCSS: "afScrollbar",
useJsScroll: !$.feat.nativeTouchScroll,
noParent: $.feat.nativeTouchScroll,
autoEnable: true,
lockBounce: this.lockPageBounce
});

description.full: This is the default transition. It simply shows the new panel and hides the old
description.summary: This is the default transition. It simply shows the new panel and hides the old

description.full: This must be called at the end of every transition to hide the old div and reset the doingTransition variable
description.summary: This must be called at the end of every transition to hide the old div and reset the doingTransition variable

description.full: This must be called at the end of every transition to remove all transforms and transitions attached to the inView object (performance + native scroll)
description.summary: This must be called at the end of every transition to remove all transforms and transitions attached to the inView object (performance + native scroll)
